byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: Brit-Ital naval battle in Aegean reptd; Ital communique admits destroyer Espero loss; claim Brit submarine sunk, plane downed and armored cars destroyed; rept Brit bases at Aden and Port Sudan bomber; Brit claims Ital base in Eritrea bombed; South African and Southern Rhodesian air forces make flights over Moyale area; Jesuit organ urges Ital Caths to fight for country

headline.main: NAVAL ENCOUNTER IN AEGEAN RELATED; Athens Hears British Convoy Was Attacked by Italian Light Ships and Planes BOTH AIR FORCES ACTIVE Britons Bomb Eritrean Base and Troops--Rome Claims To Have Sunk Submarine

lead_paragraph: ATHENS, Tuesday, July 2-- Throughout yesterday stories, presumably of mixed truth and fiction, were circulating about an engagement between British destroyers and light Italian warships aided by planes. After days of playing hideand-seek through the thickly strewn ...
